message.content:
cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.HC 

The paper discusses a system for future service robots working in human environments, which involves using 3D vision data to select appropriate alternative tools for a given task. This involves transfer learning from prior knowledge of geometric features that make a tool good for a task, which suggests a focus on robotics (cs.RO) and computer vision (cs.CV). The system also uses machine learning techniques to learn from simulated Web models performing tasks, which suggests a focus on artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). Finally, the system is designed to facilitate everyday creativity and interaction between bottom-up and top-down pressures, which suggests a focus on human-computer interaction (cs.HC).
